text: To characterize the MERS - CoV M protein in terms of its IFN antagonism , M protein was ectopically expressed in cultured cells for functional assays ( Figure 1A ) . A luciferase reporter construct driven by IFN - β promoter was used to reflect IFN - β promoter activity stimulated during infection . Sendai virus was used as a model virus to potently induce IFN expression in transfected cells . When increasing doses of M proteins were expressed in advance , a dose - dependent inhibition of IFN - β promoter activity was observed ( Figure 1B ; bars 3 - 5 compared with bar 2 ) . A similar observation was also noted when synthetic dsRNA analog poly ( I : C ) was used as an alternative inducer that specifically stimulates the RLR pathway of IFN production ( Figure 1C ; bars 3 - 5 compared with bar 2 ) . These two pieces of data are generally consistent with a previous report , 22 and they further strengthen the current model of the IFN antagonism of MERS - CoV M protein .
